It belongs to the family Ericaceae, commonly known as the heath family, and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a sensitive indicator of undisturbed ecosystems.
